swear.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to use rude and offensive language
swear.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Don’t swear in front of the children.
He turned round and swore at me.
swear.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to promise that you will do something
swear.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Do you swear on your honour (=promise very strongly) that you will never tell anyone?
Victor swore he would get his revenge.
Mona swore never to return home.
swear.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to say very strongly that what you are saying is true
swear.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I never touched your purse, I swear!
I never touched her, I swear to God.
I think it was about ten o'clock when we left, but I couldn’t swear to it (=I am not certain).
She swore blind that she had never seen him before.
He says he was there all the time, but I swear I never saw him.
swear.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to make a public official promise, especially in a court of law
swear.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Remember that you have sworn an oath and so must tell the truth.
Presidents must swear allegiance to the US constitution.
Witnesses have to swear on the Bible.
